newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: OPEC agrees to freeze its output ceiling.
newsitem.headline: OPEC agrees to freeze its output ceiling.

text.p: Ministers of the Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries agreed Wednesday to freeze their output ceiling, OPEC Secretary-General Rilwanu Lukman told reporters.

The existing accord sets a ceiling on total production by the cartel's 11 members at 25.03 million barrels daily, although monitors say quota violations have added some 2 million barrels a day to that amount.
Lukman said the new OPEC freeze would last for six months from July 1 with the member nations keeping their existing oil output quotas unchanged.
He said all members pledged to return their production to their mandated quota levels.
Monitors of the oil cartel's output say Venezuela has been the biggest violator.
